title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Thessalonians chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:3, what must happen before the day of Christ comes?
options: A falling away first and the man of sin be revealed
The gospel will be preached to all nations
questions.correctAnswer: A falling away first and the man of sin be revealed
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:3 states that the day shall not come except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed.

questions.question: Who is described as opposing and exalting himself above all that is called God in 2 Thessalonians 2?
questions.correctAnswer: The man of sin
questions.explanation: Verse 4 describes the man of sin as one who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Thessalonians 2:8: 'And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the ______ of his mouth.'
questions.correctAnswer: spirit of his mouth
questions.explanation: The verse specifically says the Lord shall consume the Wicked with the spirit of his mouth.

questions.question: What does 2 Thessalonians 2:7 say is already at work?
questions.correctAnswer: The mystery of iniquity
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states that the mystery of iniquity doth already work.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 2:2 warns not to be troubled by a letter as if the day of Christ is at hand.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 advises believers not to be troubled by spirit, word, or letter as from Paul, saying the day of Christ is at hand.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:9, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders?
questions.correctAnswer: The man of sin
questions.explanation: Verse 9 identifies 'him' whose coming is after the working of Satan as the man of sin.

questions.question: What is the reason given in 2 Thessalonians 2:10 for those who perish being deceived?
options: Because they received not the love of the truth
Because they did not hear the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Because they received not the love of the truth
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states that those who perish were deceived because they received not the love of the truth.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 2:11 says God will send a strong delusion so that people should believe a lie.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 11 clearly states God shall send them strong delusion that they should believe a lie.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 2:13, God chose believers to salvation through what means?
options: Sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states God chose believers to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth.

questions.question: What are believers instructed to do in 2 Thessalonians 2:15?
options: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught
questions.explanation: Verse 15 instructs brethren to stand fast and hold the traditions taught by word or epistle.

questions.question: Who is mentioned as giving everlasting consolation and good hope through grace in 2 Thessalonians 2:16?
options: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: Verse 16 states that Jesus Christ and God the Father have given everlasting consolation and hope through grace.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 2:6 says that what withholdeth the man of sin might be revealed in his time.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 6 says you know what withholdeth so that the man of sin might be revealed in his own time.

questions.question: What does 2 Thessalonians 2:14 say believers are called to obtain?
options: The glory of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states believers are called by the gospel to obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Thessalonians 2:17: 'Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good ______ and work.'
questions.correctAnswer: word
questions.explanation: Verse 17 ends with 'stablish you in every good word and work.'

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:1, by what two events do the brethren beseech each other?
options: The coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together unto him
The resurrection and the final judgment
The baptism and the second coming
questions.correctAnswer: The coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together unto him
questions.explanation: Verse 1 clearly states the brethren are beseeched by the coming of Jesus Christ and the gathering together unto him.

medium.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is confused about the timing of the day of Christ and is being shaken in mind by false teachings. Based on 2 Thessalonians 2, what biblical truth would you share about this?
options: The day of Christ will not come until the falling away and the man of sin is revealed.
The day of Christ is already at hand and imminent.
The day of Christ depends on our works and righteousness.
The day of Christ is a secret that no one can understand.
questions.correctAnswer: The day of Christ will not come until the falling away and the man of sin is revealed.
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:2-3 teaches believers not to be troubled by false reports that the day of Christ is near, explaining that it will not come until there is a falling away and the man of sin is revealed. This helps believers stand firm and trust God's timing.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:4 teach us about humility and the dangers of pride?
options: The man of sin opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God.
Pride is a virtue that leads to success and honor.
Exalting oneself is encouraged as a sign of spiritual growth.
Humility is not necessary if one has power.
questions.correctAnswer: The man of sin opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God.
questions.explanation: Verse 4 warns against the man of sin who exalts himself above all, showing the danger of pride and self-exaltation, which believers should avoid by practicing humility and revering God.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged and wonders if evil is already winning. According to 2 Thessalonians 2:7-8, what hope can you share?
options: The mystery of iniquity is at work but will be restrained until the right time and then the Lord will consume the Wicked.
Evil will overcome forever without any end.
Believers must fight evil alone without God's intervention.
The wicked will never be revealed or judged.
questions.correctAnswer: The mystery of iniquity is at work but will be restrained until the right time and then the Lord will consume the Wicked.
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 explain that while evil is working, God's restraining power is in place until the appointed time when the Lord Jesus will destroy the Wicked with the brightness of His coming, offering hope and assurance.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:10-12 teach us about the importance of loving the truth in our personal devotion?
options: Those who do not love the truth are deceived and condemned.
Truth is optional in Christian living.
Faith is independent of truth and love.
Believers should reject truth to avoid persecution.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who do not love the truth are deceived and condemned.
questions.explanation: Verses 10-12 emphasize that those who reject the love of the truth are given over to strong delusion and are condemned, highlighting the vital role of embracing and loving God's truth in spiritual discipline and perseverance.

questions.question: In the context of church life and fellowship, what instruction does 2 Thessalonians 2:15 offer for believers?
options: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught by word or epistle.
Ignore traditions and follow only personal feelings.
Replace all teachings with new ideas.
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught by word or epistle.
questions.explanation: Verse 15 exhorts believers to stand firm and hold fast to the teachings and traditions they have received, whether by spoken word or letter, reinforcing the importance of obedience and unity within the church.

questions.question: A believer struggles with doubt and discouragement. Based on 2 Thessalonians 2:16-17, what encouragement can you offer?
options: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father give us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace.
Discouragement is a sign of weak faith and should be ignored.
Comfort comes only from human friends, not God.
Hope is only for those who never face trials.
questions.correctAnswer: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father give us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace.
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 remind believers that Jesus and God the Father lovingly provide eternal comfort and hope by grace, encouraging steadfastness and strengthening hearts through God's word and work.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:6, the revealing of the man of sin is immediately unstoppable and will happen at any moment.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 6 explains that there is something currently withholding the man of sin's revealing until the proper time, indicating that the revealing is restrained and will happen according to God's timing.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 2 teaches that God actively sends delusion upon those who reject the truth as a form of judgment.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 11-12 state that God will send a strong delusion so that those who do not believe the truth but take pleasure in unrighteousness will be judged, showing God's righteous response to rejection of His truth.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to despair because of widespread deception. According to 2 Thessalonians 2:9-10, what should they remember about the nature of the coming of the Wicked?
options: His coming is with Satanic power, signs, lying wonders, and deceivableness of unrighteousness.
He will come without any supernatural power or influence.
His coming will be peaceful and welcomed by all.
He has no power to deceive believers.
questions.correctAnswer: His coming is with Satanic power, signs, lying wonders, and deceivableness of unrighteousness.
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 describe the Wicked as coming with Satan's power and false signs to deceive those who perish, highlighting the need for vigilance, faith, and love of truth in resisting deception.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:13-14 teach about evangelism and the calling of believers?
options: God has chosen believers for salvation through sanctification and called them by the gospel to attain the glory of Jesus Christ.
Salvation depends on human effort without divine calling.
The gospel is only for a select few and not for all believers.
Believers are called to isolation rather than sharing the gospel.
questions.correctAnswer: God has chosen believers for salvation through sanctification and called them by the gospel to attain the glory of Jesus Christ.
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 emphasize God's initiative in choosing and calling believers to salvation and glory through sanctification and faith, encouraging them to embrace their role in gospel living and witness.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with perseverance in faith amid trials. What does 2 Thessalonians 2:1-2 teach about standing firm and not being shaken?
options: Believers should not be quickly shaken or troubled by false teachings about the coming of Christ.
It is normal to be shaken and lose hope when trials come.
Faith should depend on rumors and letters rather than God's Word.
Believers should avoid thinking about the coming of Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should not be quickly shaken or troubled by false teachings about the coming of Christ.
questions.explanation: Verses 1-2 urge believers to stand firm and not be disturbed by false messages claiming the day of Christ is imminent, encouraging trust in God's timing and scriptural truth for perseverance.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:5 show the importance of remembering apostolic teaching for personal spiritual growth?
options: Paul reminds believers that he had already taught them these truths when he was with them.
Teachings of apostles are outdated and irrelevant.
Believers should rely only on their own understanding.
Spiritual growth happens without any instruction.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul reminds believers that he had already taught them these truths when he was with them.
questions.explanation: Verse 5 highlights the importance of recalling the apostolic teachings previously given, reinforcing the value of scriptural instruction for faith and obedience.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:17, believers are encouraged to ________ their hearts and be established in every good word and work.
questions.correctAnswer: Comfort
questions.explanation: Verse 17 instructs believers to comfort their hearts and be established in good words and works, promoting encouragement and steadfastness in Christian living.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to doubt God's love and grace while facing trials. Based on 2 Thessalonians 2:16, what truth would help restore their trust?
options: God the Father has loved us and given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace.
God is distant and uncaring during difficult times.
Grace is earned by human merit.
Love and consolation come only from earthly sources.
questions.correctAnswer: God the Father has loved us and given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace.
questions.explanation: Verse 16 assures believers of the Father's love and the gift of eternal comfort and hope by grace, encouraging trust and gratitude even amid hardships.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:7 illustrate the role of spiritual discipline in resisting evil?
options: The one who restrains now will continue to do so until removed, preventing full revelation of evil.
Evil should be welcomed as part of growth.
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary because evil is inevitable.
Believers should ignore the presence of iniquity.
questions.correctAnswer: The one who restrains now will continue to do so until removed, preventing full revelation of evil.
questions.explanation: Verse 7 shows that a restraining power is at work holding back the mystery of iniquity, teaching believers about God's control and the importance of perseverance and trust in spiritual discipline.

hard.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:3, what must occur before the day of Christ comes?
questions.correctAnswer: A falling away first
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:3 states that the day of Christ shall not come except there comes a falling away first.

questions.question: Who is described as "the man of sin" and "the son of perdition" in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: The Antichrist
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:3 refers to 'the man of sin' and 'the son of perdition,' traditionally interpreted as the Antichrist figure opposing God.

questions.question: What does the 'man of sin' do according to 2 Thessalonians 2:4?
options: Exalteth himself above all that is called God
Builds a sanctuary in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: Exalteth himself above all that is called God
questions.explanation: The verse describes the 'man of sin' as one who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God or worshipped.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 2:6-7, what is the significance of 'he who now letteth'?
options: He who restrains the revelation of the man of sin
questions.correctAnswer: He who restrains the revelation of the man of sin
questions.explanation: The passage speaks of a restrainer who prevents the man of sin from being revealed until the proper time, indicating a divine or providential hold.

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 2:8 describe the fate of the Wicked?
options: Consumed by the spirit of the Lord’s mouth and destroyed by the brightness of His coming
questions.correctAnswer: Consumed by the spirit of the Lord’s mouth and destroyed by the brightness of His coming
questions.explanation: The verse portrays the Wicked being destroyed by the Lord’s powerful word and the brightness of His coming, symbolizing divine judgment.

questions.question: What role does Satan play according to 2 Thessalonians 2:9?
options: He empowers the coming of the man of sin with signs and lying wonders
He restrains the man of sin
questions.correctAnswer: He empowers the coming of the man of sin with signs and lying wonders
questions.explanation: The verse explains that the coming of the Wicked is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:10, why do some perish?
options: Because they received not the love of the truth
Because they did not keep the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Because they received not the love of the truth
questions.explanation: The verse states that those who perish did so because they did not receive the love of the truth, preventing their salvation.

questions.question: What does God send to those who reject the truth, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Strong delusion
questions.explanation: The verse explains God sends a strong delusion so that those who reject the truth believe a lie.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 2:13, what has God chosen believers for?
options: Salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.explanation: The verse states that God chose believers to salvation through sanctification and belief of the truth.

questions.question: What does 2 Thessalonians 2:15 exhort the believers to do?
options: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught
questions.explanation: The verse commands believers to stand firm and keep the teachings they have received, whether by word or letter.

questions.question: Which two figures are mentioned as sources of everlasting consolation in 2 Thessalonians 2:16?
options: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: The verse identifies both Jesus Christ and God the Father as the ones who have given everlasting consolation and good hope.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:2, the believers were to be quickly shaken by letters as if the day of Christ was at hand.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse instructs believers not to be quickly shaken or troubled by letters claiming the day of Christ is near.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:12, those who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness might be ____.
questions.correctAnswer: damned
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that those who did not believe the truth but took pleasure in unrighteousness would be damned.

questions.question: How does the 'mystery of iniquity' in 2 Thessalonians 2:7 relate to the concept of spiritual warfare in the New Testament?
options: It represents the ongoing hidden work of evil until restrained
It refers to the mystery of the Trinity
It is the revelation of the gospel to Gentiles
It is the angelic announcement of Christ’s birth
questions.correctAnswer: It represents the ongoing hidden work of evil until restrained
questions.explanation: The 'mystery of iniquity' speaks of the secret and active work of evil forces until God permits their revelation, aligning with New Testament themes of spiritual conflict.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophetic theme is echoed by the description of the man of sin sitting in the temple proclaiming himself as God (2 Thessalonians 2:4)?
options: The abomination of desolation from Daniel and Jesus’ Olivet Discourse
questions.correctAnswer: The abomination of desolation from Daniel and Jesus’ Olivet Discourse
questions.explanation: This imagery parallels Daniel’s prophecy of the abomination of desolation and Jesus’ reference to it in Matthew 24, signaling sacrilegious desecration.

theological.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2, what must occur before the day of Christ comes?
options: A great falling away and the revelation of the man of sin
The rebuilding of the temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: A great falling away and the revelation of the man of sin
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:3 teaches that the day of Christ will not come except there first be a falling away and the revealing of the man of sin. This aligns with passages like Matthew 24:10-12 on apostasy and Daniel 7:25 on blasphemous opposition.

questions.question: Who is described as opposing and exalting himself above all that is called God in 2 Thessalonians 2?
questions.correctAnswer: The man of sin
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:4 identifies the man of sin as one who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God, even sitting in the temple as if he were God. This echoes Daniel 11:36-37 and Revelation 13:5-6 about blasphemous rulers.

questions.question: What is the 'mystery of iniquity' mentioned in 2 Thessalonians 2:7?
options: The secret working of lawlessness already at work in the world
The hidden knowledge of the kingdom of God
questions.correctAnswer: The secret working of lawlessness already at work in the world
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:7 speaks of the mystery of iniquity that is already at work, referring to the ongoing presence of lawlessness and rebellion against God, similar to the 'mystery' language in Ephesians 3:3-6 and the Old Testament's depiction of hidden evil (Isaiah 29:15).

questions.question: What restrains the revelation of the man of sin until the proper time, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:6-7?
options: An unknown restraining force or one who restrains
The death of the last apostle
questions.correctAnswer: An unknown restraining force or one who restrains
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:6-7 explains that something or someone restrains the man of sin until the proper time, a concept that aligns with the idea of God's sovereign timing and possibly the Holy Spirit's work (John 16:8) to hold back evil until appointed.

questions.question: How will the Lord deal with the Wicked one when he is revealed, according to 2 Thessalonians 2?
options: Consume him with the spirit of His mouth and destroy him with the brightness of His coming
Grant him a kingdom for a time
Allow him to reign for a thousand years
Ignore him until the end of the age
questions.correctAnswer: Consume him with the spirit of His mouth and destroy him with the brightness of His coming
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:8 states that the Lord Jesus will consume the Wicked one by the spirit of His mouth and destroy him by the brightness of His coming, affirming Christ's divine authority and final judgment as in Isaiah 11:4, Hebrews 1:3, and Revelation 19:15.

questions.question: What characterizes the coming of the man of sin in 2 Thessalonians 2:9?
options: Powerful working of Satan with all signs and lying wonders
A silent appearing in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: Powerful working of Satan with all signs and lying wonders
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:9 describes the man of sin’s coming as being accompanied by Satan’s power, signs, and lying wonders, demonstrating deceptive miracles similar to those warned about in Matthew 24:24 and Exodus 7:11.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2, why do some perish under the deception of unrighteousness?
options: Because they received not the love of the truth
Because they lacked knowledge of the law
Because they were poor and marginalized
Because they followed the law too strictly
questions.correctAnswer: Because they received not the love of the truth
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:10 explains that those who perish do so because they did not receive the love of the truth, a principle consistent with John 3:19-20 and Proverbs 1:29 on the consequences of rejecting truth.

questions.question: What judgment does God send upon those who reject the truth, as stated in 2 Thessalonians 2:11-12?
options: A strong delusion causing them to believe a lie
questions.correctAnswer: A strong delusion causing them to believe a lie
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:11-12 teaches that God sends a strong delusion so that those who reject the truth believe a lie, resulting in condemnation, which aligns with Romans 1:24-28 and Isaiah 66:4 regarding God giving people over to deception as judgment.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2, by what means has God chosen believers to salvation?
options: Through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:13 states believers were chosen to salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and belief of the truth, highlighting the Spirit's role in holiness (John 16:13) and the necessity of faith (Ephesians 2:8-9).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the calling mentioned in 2 Thessalonians 2:14?
options: To obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: To obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:14 explains God called believers by the gospel to obtain the glory of Jesus Christ, consistent with Romans 8:17 and Colossians 3:4 regarding future glory with Christ.

questions.question: What instruction does Paul give to the brethren in 2 Thessalonians 2:15?
options: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught by word or epistle
Abandon the church and follow new teachings
Avoid all association with other believers
Seek signs and wonders to confirm faith
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast and hold the traditions taught by word or epistle
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:15 commands believers to stand firm and hold to the traditions taught by Paul, emphasizing continuity with apostolic teaching as in 1 Corinthians 11:2 and 2 Timothy 1:13.

questions.question: Who are the sources of consolation and good hope given to believers, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:16?
options: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:16 identifies Jesus Christ and God the Father as the ones who have given believers everlasting consolation and good hope, reflecting the Trinitarian comfort found in 2 Corinthians 1:3-5 and Hebrews 6:19.

questions.question: What is the intended result of the comfort given by the Lord Jesus Christ and God the Father in 2 Thessalonians 2:17?
options: To comfort the hearts and establish believers in every good word and work
questions.correctAnswer: To comfort the hearts and establish believers in every good word and work
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:17 states that the comfort given is to strengthen believers’ hearts and establish them in good words and works, consistent with Hebrews 10:23-25 and James 2:14-26 on enduring faith and works.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 2, what is the relationship between deception and unrighteousness?
options: Deception works with unrighteousness to lead those who perish astray
Unrighteousness leads only to ignorance, not deception
questions.correctAnswer: Deception works with unrighteousness to lead those who perish astray
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:10 highlights that deception accompanies unrighteousness, leading those who perish away from salvation, paralleling Jeremiah 17:9 and 2 Timothy 3:13 about the deceitfulness of sin.

questions.question: What warning is given in 2 Thessalonians 2:2 about being shaken or troubled?
options: Do not be shaken by spirit, word, or letter claiming the day of Christ is at hand
Be shaken by every new prophecy
Only listen to letters from unknown teachers
Ignore all teachings about the end times
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be shaken by spirit, word, or letter claiming the day of Christ is at hand
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 2:2 warns believers not to be quickly shaken or troubled by any spirit, word, or letter falsely claiming the day of Christ has arrived, consistent with Jesus’ teaching in Matthew 24:4-5 and 2 Peter 3:17.
